description: From Latin līnea (“line, thread”), via Spanish línea in reference to the unit of length, from līnum (“flax”). Doublet of line.

entries.meaning: (astronomy, geology) Any long marking, dark or bright, on a planet or moon's surface.
examples: The moons Dione and Europa have prominent lineae.

entries.meaning: (historical) A traditional Spanish unit of length, equivalent to about 1.9 mm.
